ironMan: It’s an imperfect world, but it’s the only one we got. I guarantee you the day weapons are no longer needed to keep the peace, I’ll start making bricks and beams for baby hospitals.

cap: When I went under, the world was at war. I wake up, they say we won. They didn’t say what we lost.
Yeah, we compromised. Sometimes in ways that made us not sleep so well. But we did it so the people could be free. This isn’t freedom, this is fear.
We all need family. The Avengers are yours, maybe more so than mine.
You ready to follow Captain America into the jaws of death?
There are men laying down their lives. I got no right to do any less than them. That’s what you don’t understand. This isn’t about me.
It was not my first kiss since 1945. I’m 95; I’m not dead.
You dare Threaten me, Thor, with so puny a weapon?
No one asked you to look, Tony.Avengers! Assemble.
You know for the longest time I dreamed about coming overseas and being on the front lines. Serving my country. I finally get everything I wanted, and I’m wearing tights.
I don’t want to kill anyone. I don’t like bullies; I don’t care where they’re from.

If we sign this, we surrender our right to choose. What if this panel sends us somewhere we don’t think we should go? What if there’s somewhere we need to go and they don’t let us? We may not be perfect but the safest hands are still our own.
Don’t do anything stupid until I come back.
You start running, they’ll never let you stop. You stand up, push back. Can’t say no forever, right?

I’d offer to make you dinner, but you look miserable enough already.

This job, we try to save as many people as we can. Sometimes that doesn’t mean everybody. But if we can’t find a way to live with that, next time… maybe nobody gets saved.You can’t read that in a museum.

thanos: Little one, it’s a simple calculus. this universe is finite, its resources, finite. if life is left unchecked, life will cease to exist. It needs correcting.
I ignored my destiny once. I cannot do that again. even for you. I’m sorry, gamora.
I'M A SURVIVOR.

I thought that by eliminating half of life, the other half would thrive. But you have shown me… that’s impossible. as long as there are those that remember what was, there will always be those, that are unable to accept what can be. They will resist..
The hardest choices require the strongest wills.

I know what it’s like to lose. To feel so desperately that you’re right, yet to fail nonetheless. It’s frightening, turns the legs to jelly. I ask you to what end? dread it. Run from it. destiny arrives all the same. And now it’s here. Or should i say, I am.

Look. pretty, isn’t it? perfectly balance. as all things should be.

You could not live with your own failure, and where did that bring you? back to me.

I am…inevitable.
The universe will now be set right. Made over to fit my unique view of what should be. Let nihilism reign supreme!
It’s frightening. Turns the legs to jelly. But i ask you, to what end? dread it, run from it… destiny arrives all the same. And now, it’s here. Or should i say… i am.
Your politics bore me. Your demeanor is that of a pouty child.
Today i lost more than you could now, but now is no time to mourn. Now, is no time at all.

You were going to bed hungry, scrounging for scraps. Your planet was on the brink of collapse. I’m the one who stopped that. You know what’s happened since then? the children born have known nothing but full bellies and clear skies. It’s a paradise.
Fun isn’t something one considers when balancing the universe. But this… does put a smile on my face.
I will shred this universe down to its last atom and then, with the stones you’ve collected for me, create a new one. It is not what is lost but only what it is been given… a grateful universe.
